name: The Chanric Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I and 6 other friends stayed at the Channric for 3 nights and every one of us loved this B&B and can't wait to get back for another stay. The hosts were awesome. Attentive and available, but gave us the right amount of space to do our own thing. They also went the extra mile to help make winery reservations and to get us the best tables at our selected restaurants. The breakfasts were unbelievable and were the perfect start to a day in Napa. The pool and hot tub were also great.
reviews.title: Perfect Napa B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B decor was great. The rooms were beautiful and the beds were heavenly (and I am picky about beds). My wife and I stayed in the downstairs Jacuzzi room discussed in other reviews on this site. We had no problem with the room, and loved it. Neither of us noticed the noise issue others talked about. The bathroom was also a bit larger in this room which was nice. If you are looking for some extra privacy and more space I would suggest this room.
reviews.title: This style is how a 21st century B & B should be run......

likes.disliked: — It was 42oC on the day we arrived which is nothing the inn could prevent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: Overall we loved the Channric and would gladly recommend it to others. We hope to be back soon.
reviews.title: Loved the friendly and romantic Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As fellow innkeepers from Woodstock Vermont who detest pink, lace and false flowers, we have nothing but praise for the guys running this place. We spent many hours looking on the internet for a place that suits our tastes, similar to our inn but with a degree on individuality. In Napa we were amazed in having difficulty in finding such an establishment.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B!

likes.liked: — decor, feeling of having run of house and of course brunck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the Channric inn they have taken a property that was stuck in the 1980's and moved it visually into the 21st century. They offer simplicity with a contemporary style and impressive non traditional breakfasts. No French toast or waffles here! Ric cooks and serves a simple breakfast but the style and variety is impressive.
reviews.title: Thank you for a great vacation!

likes.liked: — The owners, the wine, the atmosphere.
likes.disliked: — The price but eh gotta chip in if you want that kind of quality resort :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Chanric Inn. Ric and Channing were very hospitable, the grounds and inn were beautiful, and breakast was fantastic. Would highly recommed it! Will be back.
reviews.title: wish we could have stayed longer...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chanric Inn is lovely. We especially liked the outdoor area (the noise from 29 didn't bother us). It was very fun to eat a delicious breakfast outside each morning (the multiple courses were a nice touch). But, we didn't want to spend a lot of time in our room. In fairness we did request the room we got, because we wanted the jacuzzi tub. But we didn't realize it would be underneath the kitchen. This meant we had to keep the shades down, as our windows looked up onto a path - that gave it a basement feel even though it was a pretty room. And then we had to listen to the disposal, the dishwasher, and other noise thumping above in the middle of the day. The house music beat was very audible downstairs, too. So it wasn't a romantic room. I did like the inn, the decor, the breakfasts, the hot tub, and the fantastic hosts. But for this price point I'd probably try another inn next time, because it is important to me to be able to spend time in the room.
reviews.title: Loved the Inn, but not wild about being under the kitchen

likes.disliked: — room underneath kitchen was noisy and felt like basement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Chanric Inn over the Auction Napa Valley weekend. I spent many hours researching various B&B's in the Napa Valley area. This was our 5th trip to the area over the past 3 years, so we come here fairly often for the weather, the wine and the relaxation. First, this B&B is very unique, and sets itself apart from other B&B's. It's modern and stylishly decorated with a warm contemporary feel. We stayed in a room downstairs with a king size bed and a large attached bath with jacuzzi tub/shower combo. The bed was very comfortable (almost as good as home) and the bath updated and modern. The only caveat with this room was that it was located below the kitchen. We heard some "traffic" noise from above around 7 am, but my husband and I are early risers, so the noise didn't really bother us. There are six other rooms to choose from. I believe there are 3 downstairs and 4 upstairs. Some have attached baths and some baths are located across the hall from their rooms. We saw three of the rooms, and they were all decorated similarly with beautiful soft white linens, and neutral wall and floor colorings. The kitchen is beautiful, and the envy of any cook! A three course breakfast is prepared each morning, and is really amazing. Kudos to Chef Ric! The first course is scones/muffins or other baked goodies, followed by a course of fruit and then the main entree. Juice and coffee are served with breakfast and is usually served on their patio (weather permitting). The patio is absolutely lovely. Citrus trees, strawberry plants, herbs and flowers decorate the stone patio. There is also dining available inside right off of the kitchen. The most unique feature is their complimentary beverage service available 24/7. There is a small refrigerator stocked with bottled water, soft drinks, wine and beer. The owners fully encourage partaking of this feature. Speaking of the owners, Channing and Ric are courteous and attentive to their guests needs. My husband and I had to leave early Sunday morning before breakfast was served, but Ric had prepared a "to go" breakfast of freshly baked scones, jam and butter along with coffee. What a truly nice and thoughtful gesture! I've noticed some other reviews regarding the street noise. Yes, you can hear the traffic from Hwy 29, but it never awoke my husband and me. I consider myself a light sleeper, and I never awoke because of traffic noise. There are several resorts and B&B's located off of Hwy 29, Silverado Trail etc... We've stayed in several over our five trips to the area, and road noise has been a minor factor with all of them. Channing and Ric have done an amazing job with the renovation and they provide a unique B&B experience that we will always remember! We're looking forward to a return stay!
reviews.title: Unique B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: We followed the advice from other TripAdvisor reviewers and were not disappointed. The Chanric is a wonderful place to stay. The decor is contemporary, not frilly. The beds and pillows were so comfortable! The towels were really plush. As others have said, Ric's breakfast were excellent. He carefully prepares a beautiful three course breakfast (really brunch) each morning. Delicious!! Channing and Ric were wonderful hosts -- friendly and helpful but not obtrusive. The only negative thing we could say is that our downstairs room smelled a bit musty and was damp.
reviews.title: Wonderful Accommodations; Excellend Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Chanric is truly a gem!!
reviews.title: Best Breakfast Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a surprise trip for my wife and our first wedding anniversary. We’ve never been to Napa/ Calistoga but will definitely return, and will undoubtedly stay at the Chanric Inn!
reviews.title: Almost perfection...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A little background- the wife and I are both in our mid- 20’s, we both work in the Hospitality industry and travel quite frequently, on business and leisure. We typically stay at upscale hotels, and the Chanric did not disappoint. I was a little concerned with the number of positive reviews (and only 1 negative) on TA- this typically tells me the hotel is writing the reviews themselves, or at least having friends write for them. But after arriving at the Inn, actually seeing and feeling things, helping myself to a fridge full of beer/ wine, and indulging in the most amazing, fresh cooked breakfast- I knew all the reviews were true!
reviews.title: A Consistent Message - Always Good!

likes.liked: — Be prepared to handle a flight of stairs. No big deal if you are not on crutches, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honest Review: The Inn is in a beautiful location; great scenery. One of the reasons I choose this B and B is because it didn’t look like your typical B and B…when you think BnB you think floral designs, lace and pink (basically Grandma’s house)…The house is very clean; the kitchen looked spotless; décor was great- very sleek and modern- and as expected. The patio area was very nice, clean and relaxing. Sitting at the kitchen table and meeting the other guests, having a drink (the beer/ wine/ sodas/ H2O available 24/7 was great) was one of the best parts of our stay. Ric and Channing are very hospitable and entertaining! They are available for recommendations to wineries, restaurants, activities, etc. - they were extremely helpful! Ric’s breakfast was AMAZING! And Channing’s service, and humor, during breakfast was great!
reviews.title: Another fantastic stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keeping it real: While our stay at the Chanric was great overall, there are always things that can be improved upon…and I include the following, not as deterrent to choose the Chanric, but to let the innkeepers know about things that could make this place Perfect…I’m just keeping it real! Cons: The pool area could’ve been a little cleaner. A good pressure washing of the surrounding concrete as well as a good cleaning of the bottom and sides of the pool could really make this area a lot nicer. There was a little bit of mold in the shower of our room- not a lot- but in a crevice that circled one side of the shower- An easy fix with some bleach. The bathroom in general didn’t seem to match the décor for the rest of the Inn. Our bathroom had old, dated and worn out cabinets under the sink area; the floors were old laminate flooring; also the shower is a glass door with dated gold trim- it just didn’t flow with the rest of the décor. Again, none of these issues were deal breakers- and shouldn't keep you from staying here!
reviews.title: we can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would definitely recommend the Chanric Inn for your trip to Napa/ Calistoga. You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: A Step away from Bliss.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chanric for just one night the first week in Oct. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer. The rooms were clean and the beds super comfy. Ric and Channing are incredible hosts.
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They provide complimentary beer, wine and soft drinks wich is so convenient! We enjoyed a glass of wine at the hot tub at night after dinner. I can't forget to mention how incredible the breakfast was. It was one of the best meals that we had on our trip. The Chanric is just a magical place that I would recommend to anyone. We loved it!
reviews.title: Absolutely Pefect

likes.disliked: — We cut our stay too short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I truly can not say enough good things about The Chanric Inn. We were greated by Ric with a handshake and friendly smile. Then, Channing the next morning. They are great!! The hospitality was phenomenal. We felt at home and welcome.
reviews.title: Loved our weekend stay!

likes.liked: — Loved the comfy bed and sheets!
likes.disliked: — Walk up the driveway if not getting a topside parking space - kidding - it's not that bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are top quality, as well as the service. They are two incredibly talented men; they have a gift for people and the knowledge of how to delivery their skills. Great, fabulous, super, outstanding...need I go on?
reviews.title: Will be coming to The Chanric again...and for years to come...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, my husband and I typically do not stay at a place more than once because we enjoy new experiences. However, we are making an exception and adding a yearly visit with Channing and Ric to our agendas. We will continue to return, along with the other couple who stayed as well.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn

description: The Chanric Inn, recommended by Condé Nast Johansens, offers exquisite service and enticing packages. Focused on the discerning culinary traveler, indulge in a multi-course, chef-prepared brunch and complimentary wet bar, late afternoon hors d'oeuvres with wines, Schramsberg at night . Also, enjoy soul-soothing massage treatments in our tranquil spa, hot Jacuzzi and nice pool with view. Take advantage of special rates with our packages that combine all the best that Napa Valley has to offer. We adhere to an eco-friendly and green philosophy
